questions.question: How does MMSE equalization differ from ZF equalization in terms of noise handling?

answers.a: MMSE minimizes mean square error but increases noise
answers.b: MMSE minimizes mean square error while balancing noise and ISI
answers.d: MMSE amplifies noise as channel gain

explanations.a: Unlike ZF, MMSE equalization doesn’t simply invert the channel. It finds an optimal balance between minimizing ISI and controlling noise amplification.

questions.question: Which equalization method typically has better Bit Error Rate (BER) performance at low SNR levels?

explanations.a: MMSE is more robust at low SNRs because it minimizes the overall error, taking noise into account, whereas ZF often amplifies noise.
